<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/23/simone-biles-vaults-nike-athleta?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Biles Vaults to Athleta
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Simone Biles" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=536 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/urNnB16e8aXaTZdWCI/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Simone Biles" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/urNnB16e8aXaTZdWCI/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy / NBC</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Simone Biles, the most decorated gymnast of all time, is leaving Nike for Athleta in a move that highlights the changing landscape of athlete sponsorships.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In an </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/simone-biles-gymnastics-nike-athleta-11619140549?mod=hp_lead_pos12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interview with the WSJ</a></span><span>, Biles praised Athleta for its commitment to “diversity and inclusion, of all women, backgrounds, ages, sizes, abilities, and races.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Founded in 1998 and now owned by Gap, Athleta is a women’s activewear brand that’s plucked not one, but <em>two</em> star female Olympic athletes from Nike. Sprinter Allyson Felix switched teams in 2019 after joining other Olympian runners in <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/22/opinion/allyson-felix-pregnancy-nike.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criticizing</a> Nike for not sufficiently supporting pregnant athletes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s easy to see what Athleta offers Felix and Biles: a company “truly for women by women,” said the gymnast. Athleta is women-led, and women account for 97% of its workforce.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Athleta is small compared to the giants of sports apparel, but after signing Biles and a pandemic year that juiced athleisure sales, it’s staring down Lululemon. Athleta’s goal is to hit $2 billion in sales by 2023.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Over on the Nike partnerships team, it’s been an interesting week</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, Complex Magazine reported that the estate of Kobe Bryant, the NBA legend who died in a helicopter crash last January, did <a href="https://www.complex.com/sneakers/kobe-bryant-nike-deal-over?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not renew</a> its sneaker deal with Nike.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Kobe’s shoes were relatively “low priority” at Nike’s basketball division, but </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/21/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-nike-deal.html?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20210422&instance_id=29541&nl=dealbook&regi_id=83342785&segment_id=56091&te=1&user_id=6e8f5c5256f51c870f4df90ca819260d&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about 20%</a></span><span> of NBA players wore Kobe Bryant’s signature shoes last season.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because of Kobe’s sudden death, the current situation with his estate has “no analogue in basketball or sneaker history,” reports the NYT. Kobe’s widow Vanessa Bryant said she’s “hoping to forge a lifelong partnership with Nike that reflects my husband’s legacy,” but legal filings show the estate has filed for more than 13 trademarks since May 2020. That means Vanessa could be <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/20/kobe-bryants-estate-may-be-quietly-planning-to-launch-its-own-brand-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gearing up</a> to launch an independent brand. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/23/vaccine-tracker-april-24?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/23/vaccine-tracker-april-24" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzcxL3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the US…</strong>J&J’s back. Health officials said J&J’s one-shot vaccine could resume after a total of 15 women experienced <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-23/j-j-vaccine-linked-cases-more-than-double-to-15-researchers-say?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rare but sometimes deadly blood clots</a> and the rollout was paused. Regulators on both sides of the Atlantic have said the benefits of the vaccine outweigh the downsides, but the FDA will include a warning statement about the clotting risks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Around the world…</strong>optimistic new research from the UK found that Covid infections <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/uk-vaccination-studies-find-significant-drop-covid-19-infections-2021-04-22/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell by 65%</a> after adults received the first dose from AstraZeneca or Pfizer. And in Israel, which has sprinted to vaccinate residents, <a href="https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/coronavirus-in-israel-129-new-cases-04-percent-tests-positive-666129?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">zero daily Covid deaths</a> were reported for the first time in 10 months.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">More headlines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Demand dampens: </strong>The <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/23/covid-19-cases-deaths-vaccinations-daily-update.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">daily average</a> for vaccinations in the US has fallen below 3 million for the first time in weeks, and some mass vaccination sites across the country are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/23/us/some-mass-vaccination-sites-in-the-us-begin-to-close-as-demand-falls-in-many-areas.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closing</a> due to lower demand. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">US is consulting but not committing: </strong>The CDC is providing “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-23/u-s-consulting-with-india-on-virus-but-isn-t-offering-vaccines?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">technical assistance</a>” to India to help manage the country’s brutal second wave, but President Biden said that the US won’t be sharing any vaccines right now, despite stockpiling AstraZeneca shots that aren’t yet authorized in the US.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/23/spacexs-second-launch-nasa-reaches-orbit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
SpaceX Sends Its Recyclables Into Orbit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/23/spacexs-second-launch-nasa-reaches-orbit" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Falcon 9 rocket set up for launch of Endeavour" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODQ5L3NwYWNleF9jcmV3LTJfbGF1bmNoLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NASA/Joel Kowsky</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bookended by Monday’s historic <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2021/04/23/smartphone-chip-powered-nasas-historic-flight-mars?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mars helicopter flight</a> and yesterday’s <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/23/spacexs-crew-2-mission-for-nasa-launches-successfully-reaches-orbit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SpaceX launch</a>, it’s been a fine week for anyone who grew up rewatching <em>October Sky</em>. At 5:49 am ET, the Falcon 9 rocket launched a Crew Dragon spacecraft called Endeavour into orbit. A lot of rad names there, but what you really need to know is the Crew-2 mission is SpaceX’s second operational crew launch since partnering with NASA and its third to date.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Crew-2 crew of four astronauts will spend six months on the International Space Station and join the members of Crew-1, who got up there in November. Other interesting mission facts:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>SpaceX has sent 10 astronauts to space in under a year.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This is the first time the company has reused a rocket and capsule from a past mission—something CEO Elon Musk said is key to making space exploration cheaper.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>One of the astronauts in the capsule’s first flight last May was Robert Behnken, current Crew-2 copilot Megan McArthur’s husband. Cuuuute.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> NASA said that SpaceX’s and Boeing’s contracts have saved the agency more than $20 billion in development costs—as opposed to when it solely relied on Russian spacecrafts.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY BOMBAY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Let Us Distill Some Knowledge for You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://attach.mikmak.tv/b6d3597c/6bc30367-487f-a42f-831c-bcf4715b2c6c?channelType=email&trafficType=paid&attachCampaignName=q4-morning-brew-stir-creativity&handle=bombay-sapphire&platformType=email&adPlacementType=na&adUnitType=static-ad&paidAudienceType=morning-brew-newsletter-subscribers&adUnitCreative=newsletter-daily-brew-primary-424&campaignObjectiveType=awareness" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bombay" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjc4OS8xNjE2NTEyNTI2LTE1MDB4ODAwXy1fR1QucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Perfectly distilled gin takes a master. More specifically, it takes Dr. Anne Brock—the Bombay Master Distiller. Yes, that’s a real title, and yes Dr. Brock is just as impressive as the bright, perfectly balanced, vibrant flavor of <a href="https://attach.mikmak.tv/b6d3597c/6bc30367-487f-a42f-831c-bcf4715b2c6c?channelType=email&trafficType=paid&attachCampaignName=q4-morning-brew-stir-creativity&handle=bombay-sapphire&platformType=email&adPlacementType=na&adUnitType=static-ad&paidAudienceType=morning-brew-newsletter-subscribers&adUnitCreative=newsletter-daily-brew-primary-424&campaignObjectiveType=awareness" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombay Sapphire</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can think of the masterminds at Bombay as the intelligentsia of gin. Not <em>only</em> does their Master Distiller have a PhD in Organic Chemistry from Oxford (you read that right), they also have a Master of Botanicals who hand-selects <strong style="color:#000">sustainably sourced botanicals</strong>—<a href="https://attach.mikmak.tv/b6d3597c/6bc30367-487f-a42f-831c-bcf4715b2c6c?channelType=email&trafficType=paid&attachCampaignName=q4-morning-brew-stir-creativity&handle=bombay-sapphire&platformType=email&adPlacementType=na&adUnitType=static-ad&paidAudienceType=morning-brew-newsletter-subscribers&adUnitCreative=newsletter-daily-brew-primary-424&campaignObjectiveType=awareness" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">like Moroccan cubeb berries and West African Grains</a>—from around the world. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So when you’re sipping a classic G&T or opting for a friskier cocktail (might we suggest grapefruit and rosemary), <strong style="color:#000">Bombay Sapphire is the perfect base to elevate your beverage</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No matter how you drink it, Bombay is without ques-<em>gin</em>, a better gin. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://attach.mikmak.tv/b6d3597c/6bc30367-487f-a42f-831c-bcf4715b2c6c?channelType=email&trafficType=paid&attachCampaignName=q4-morning-brew-stir-creativity&handle=bombay-sapphire&platformType=email&adPlacementType=na&adUnitType=static-ad&paidAudienceType=morning-brew-newsletter-subscribers&adUnitCreative=newsletter-daily-brew-primary-424&campaignObjectiveType=awareness" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Enjoy the refreshing taste of Bombay today</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Despite award show ratings tanking, Disney said that it has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/22/oscars-sells-out-ad-inventory-despite-awards-show-ratings-declines.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold out</a> of its ad inventory for the Oscars, which airs this Sunday night on ABC. The show brings in more ad money for ABC than any other day on the calendar ($129 million in 2020). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We clearly misjudged how this deal would be viewed by the wider football community and how it might impact them in the future. We will learn from this.”  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">JPMorgan issued a statement <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/jpmorgan-says-it-misjudged-backing-european-super-league-2021-04-23/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apologizing</a> for its role in the dumpster fire that was the Super League. The bank faced a barrage of criticism on social media for bankrolling the breakaway soccer league with $4.2 billion in financing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Thoughts on moving to Miami. <th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/23/italian-man-skips-work-15-years-still-gets-paid?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Italian Man Achieves Perfect Work-Life Balance
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ever get away with ditching a day of work? Two in a row? A whole week? Well, Italian hospital employee Salvatore Scumace is going to top you no matter what: He skipped every shift <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/23/world/europe/italy-hospital-worker-15-years.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">for 15 years</a> but still made over $650,000. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When the 67-year-old was supposed to be monitoring hospital security cameras for fires, he reportedly took nice strolls, told his neighbors he was retired, or chillaxed at home. But his days sipping mid-morning Aperol spritzes are behind him: This week, Italian authorities put his epic ditching streak in the spotlight when they announced they’re investigating his case. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Scumace’s not the only one...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Slacking off as a public sector worker is a rampant-enough problem in Italy that Italians call perpetrators a name that roughly translates to “timecard weasels.” And since 2016, the government has taken steps to crack down on this growing Italian boogle (group of weasels). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Scumace could face charges of abuse of office, forgery, and aggravated extortion, but he’ll <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/apr/21/italian-king-of-absentees-allegedly-skipped-work-for-15-years?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go down in Italian history</a> as the “king of absentees.” </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morning Brew is teaming up with <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/484951944;291136565;v?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">H&R Block</a> to give you the facts, the context, and the tips you need to make sure you're prepared for the most complex tax filing season we can all remember.</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFounded in 1998 and now owned by Gap, Athleta is a women’s activewear brand that’s plucked not one, but \u003cem\u003etwo\u003c/em\u003e star female Olympic athletes from Nike. Sprinter Allyson Felix switched teams in 2019 after joining other Olympian runners in \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/22/opinion/allyson-felix-pregnancy-nike.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecriticizing\u003c/a\u003e Nike for not sufficiently supporting pregnant athletes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s easy to see what Athleta offers Felix and Biles: a company “truly for women by women,” said the gymnast. Athleta is women-led, and women account for 97% of its workforce.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAthleta is small compared to the giants of sports apparel, but after signing Biles and a pandemic year that juiced athleisure sales, it’s staring down Lululemon. Athleta’s goal is to hit $2 billion in sales by 2023.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOver on the Nike partnerships team, it’s been an interesting week\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, Complex Magazine reported that the estate of Kobe Bryant, the NBA legend who died in a helicopter crash last January, did \u003ca href=\"https://www.complex.com/sneakers/kobe-bryant-nike-deal-over?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot renew\u003c/a\u003e its sneaker deal with Nike.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eKobe’s shoes were relatively “low priority” at Nike’s basketball division, but \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/21/sports/basketball/kobe-bryant-nike-deal.html?campaign_id=4\u0026emc=edit_dk_20210422\u0026instance_id=29541\u0026nl=dealbook\u0026regi_id=83342785\u0026segment_id=56091\u0026te=1\u0026user_id=6e8f5c5256f51c870f4df90ca819260d\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabout 20%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of NBA players wore Kobe Bryant’s signature shoes last season.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause of Kobe’s sudden death, the current situation with his estate has “no analogue in basketball or sneaker history,” reports the NYT. Kobe’s widow Vanessa Bryant said she’s “hoping to forge a lifelong partnership with Nike that reflects my husband’s legacy,” but legal filings show the estate has filed for more than 13 trademarks since May 2020. That means Vanessa could be \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/20/kobe-bryants-estate-may-be-quietly-planning-to-launch-its-own-brand-.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egearing up\u003c/a\u003e to launch an independent brand. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL Sky\u003c/em\u003e. At 5:49 am ET, the Falcon 9 rocket launched a Crew Dragon spacecraft called Endeavour into orbit. A lot of rad names there, but what you really need to know is the Crew-2 mission is SpaceX’s second operational crew launch since partnering with NASA and its third to date.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Crew-2 crew of four astronauts will spend six months on the International Space Station and join the members of Crew-1, who got up there in November. Other interesting mission facts:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpaceX has sent 10 astronauts to space in under a year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis is the first time the company has reused a rocket and capsule from a past mission—something CEO Elon Musk said is key to making space exploration cheaper.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne of the astronauts in the capsule’s first flight last May was Robert Behnken, current Crew-2 copilot Megan McArthur’s husband. Cuuuute.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e NASA said that SpaceX’s and Boeing’s contracts have saved the agency more than $20 billion in development costs—as opposed to when it solely relied on Russian style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEver get away with ditching a day of work? But his days sipping mid-morning Aperol spritzes are behind him: This week, Italian authorities put his epic ditching streak in the spotlight when they announced they’re investigating his case. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSlacking off as a public sector worker is a rampant-enough problem in Italy that Italians call perpetrators a name that roughly translates to “timecard weasels.” And since 2016, the government has taken steps to crack down on this growing Italian boogle (group of weasels). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eScumace could face charges of abuse of office, forgery, and class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ego down in Italian history\u003c/a\u003e as the “king of
